gurmukhi: jx nt l~Qy CwlI; Foil bjwie kY ]
transliteration: Jan Nat Lathe Dhaalidhol(i) Bajaae Kai||
translation: It appears that the actors, sounding their drum, have jumped into the war-arena.
The dagger penetrated in the corpse seems like a blood stained fish entrapped in the net.

gurmukhi: Gx ivic ijau CMCwlI; qygW hsIAW ]
translation: The swords glistened like the lightning in the clouds.
The swords have covered (the battlefield) like the winter-fog.39.

transliteration: Dhougad Sauhen Aaeeaan Roh Badhaae Kai||
translation: The trumpets were sounded with the beating of drum-stick and the armies attacked each other.
The youthful warriors pulled out their swords from their scabbards.
Sranwat Beej increased himself into innumerable forms.

gurmukhi: durgw sauhy AweIAW; roh bFwie kY ]
transliteration: Durgad Sauhen Aaeeaan Roh Badhaae Kai||
translation: Which came in front of Durga, highly enraged.

gurmukhi: sBnI Awx vgweIAW; qygW DUih kY ]
translation: All of them pulled out their swords and struck.

gurmukhi: durgw sB bcweIAW; Fwl sMBwl kY ]
transliteration: Durgad Sabh Bachaaeeaan Dhaal Sandhaal Kai||
translation: Durga saved herself from all, holding her shield carefully.

gurmukhi: dyvI Awp clweIAW; qik qik dwnvI ]
translation: The goddess herself then struck her sword looking carefully toward the demons.
She steeped her naked swords in blood.

gurmukhi: swrsuqI jx nHweIAW; iml kY dyvIAW ]
translation: It appeared that the goddesses gathering together, took their bath in river Saraswati.

gurmukhi: sBy mwr igrweIAW; AMdir Kyiq dY ]
transliteration: Sabhe Maar Giraaeeaan Andar(i) Khet Dai||
translation: The goddess hath killed and thrown on the ground in the battlefield (all the forms of Sranwat Beej).
